definition: the side or part of an object that presents itself to view or that is normally seen or used first; the most forward part of something
example: a page at the front of the book had been torn out

definition: located or situated on every side
unusual or surprising in a way that is unsettling or hard to understand
a long narrow band or strip, typically of the same width throughout its length, differing in color or texture from the surface on either side of it
example: a pair of blue shorts with pink stripes

definition: a container used to hold or carry things, typically made from interwoven strips of cane or wire
(of a slope, flight of stairs, angle, ascent, etc.) rising or falling sharply; nearly perpendicular
example: she pushed the bike up the steep hill

definition: hard solid nonmetallic mineral matter of which rock is made, especially as a building material
example: the houses are built of stone

definition: have or maintain an upright position, supported by one's feet
bear all or part of the weight of; hold up
example: the dome was supported by a hundred white columns

definition: an animal, especially a large or dangerous four-footed one
a device for recording visual images in the form of photographs, film, or video signals
